article.title: In Photos: Halloween 2017
article.description: Halloweekend 2017 brought with it spooky decorations in local businesses and homes, a visit from UC Santa Barbara Chancellor Henry T. Yang and a dance-filled DJ set at the Thunderdome.Â
article.content:
The spirits were high and the costumes were ghoulish this weekend in Isla Vista. Halloweekend 2017 brought with it spooky decorations in local businesses and homes, a visit from UC Santa Barbara Chancellor Henry T. Yang and a dance-filled DJ set at the Thunderdome.

Photos by Daily Nexus photographers

Kaitlyn Nguyen / Daily Nexus
Chancellor Henry T. Yang and his wife, Dilling Yang, pose for a photo with students during their annual Halloween Isla Vista walk. Dustin Harris / Daily Nexus
Michelle Sharp / Daily Nexus
Isla Vistans put up decorations on balconies and porches. Michelle Sharp / Daily Nexus
French DJ Tchami performs at the 2017 Delirium concert on Saturday night. Will Tracy / Daily Nexus
Kaitlyn Nguyen / Daily Nexus
Concert attendees dance along to Tchamiâs set. Will Tracy / Daily Nexus
Kaitlyn Nguyen/Daily Nexus
Will Tracy / Daily Nexus
Sicheng Wang / Daily Nexus
Dustin Harris / Daily Nexus
Police officers stand outside Del Playa Drive. Sicheng Wang / Daily Nexus
Print

A cool team of photographers who preserves the visual memory of UCSB and Isla Vista.

related.title: In Photos: A.S. Elections 2018
related.description: This year's Associated Students election saw tears of joy and of disappointment. Relive the night below:
related.content:
This yearâs Associated Students election saw tears of joy and of disappointment. Relive the night below:

The Isla Vista Party won three of the five Associated Students executive seats. Jose Ochoa / Daily Nexus
Jose Ochoa / Daily Nexus
Jose Ochoa / Daily Nexus
Campus United won one of five executive seats with Brooke Kopel becoming Associated Students president. Jose Ochoa / Daily Nexus
Grecia Martinez, an independent candidate, is the new Associated Students Student Advocate General. Jose Ochoa / Daily Nexus
Mayela Morales, with Isla Vista Party, is the new Associated Students external vice president for statewide affairs. Jose Ochoa / Daily Nexus
Morales smiles as the final results roll in. Jose Ochoa / Daily Nexus
Steven Ho celebrates his win. Ho will be next yearâs Associated Students internal vice president. Jose Ochoa / Daily Nexus
Ho celebrates his win with fellow Isla Vista Party members. Jose Ochoa / Daily Nexus
Brooke Kopel, with Campus United, is the new Associated Students president. Jose Ochoa / Daily Nexus

related.title: In Photos | Deltopia 2019
related.description: Daily NexusÂ photographers captured this year's Deltopia celebrations.
related.content:
The annual I.V. holiday was upon us this past weekend, and while the wild nature of Deltopia has diminished in recent years, the sense of community and inclusiveness has only grown.

Daily NexusÂ photographers captured this yearâs celebrations, available in the gallery below.

related.title: In Photos | Community Garden Grand Opening
related.description: The new community garden is located at University United Methodist Church, on the corner of Sueno and Camino del Sur.
related.content:
On Sunday morning, UC Santa Barbaraâs Edible Campus Program, the Isla Vista Community Services District and University United Methodist Church hosted the grand opening of the Edible Garden Project. The new community garden is located at University United Methodist Church, on the corner of Sueno and Camino del Sur. The event included food, live music, crafts and sidewalk chalk art.

Photos from the grand opening can be viewed below:

This slideshow requires JavaScript.
